sentence.Network_en: According to the old tradition, Romulus was the founder of Rome.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照古老的传说, 罗穆卢斯是古罗马的建国者.

sentence.Network_en: All night long Romulus sat alone on the summit of the Palatine.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗穆卢斯通夜独自坐在帕拉太恩山顶上.

sentence.Network_en: Romulus began at once to lay off the bounds of his little town.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗穆卢斯立即开始规划他的小镇的边界.

means.word_mean: 1. (Roman mythology) founder of Rome; suckled with his twin brother Remus by a wolf after their parents (Mars and Rhea Silvia) abandoned them; Romulus killed Remus in an argument over the building of Rome
